conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles A and B based on their velocity-time graphs to find the ratio of acceleration magnitudes during deceleration phases.
For particle A, the graph shows a deceleration phase from t0 to 3t0, and for particle B, it shows a deceleration phase from 3t0 to 6t0.
Acceleration for particle A during deceleration phase is calculated as -1/2 m/s^2.
Acceleration for particle B during deceleration phase is calculated as -v0/3t0.
Calculate the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations a_A and a_B as 3t0/v0.
The ratio of accelerations is independent of the initial velocity v0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations is 3t0/v0.
